item.title: 2 Big Reasons America’s Booster Rates are Lagging
item.description: The two main reasons that Americans are not getting booster shots are issues with timing and political polarization through media consumption.

item.title: You probably don't need another booster
item.description: Some parts of the immune system sustained, showing strong response to any new coronavirus variant.

item.title: Covid News: New York Backs Off Booster Mandate for Health Care Workers
item.description: Since around 25% of New Yorkers with a career in healthcare are unwilling to get the booster shot, NYC hospitals are dropping the requirement to get a booster in order to maintain a staff.

item.title: Waning Vaccine Effectiveness
item.description: … the effectiveness of double vaccinations and triple vaccinations fall of from 87% and 91% to 66% and 78% respectively

item.title: Discussion of fourth shot
item.description: more nations are discussing the possibility of fourth doses of coronavirus vaccine for their most vulnerable. In the United States, health officials emphasized late last year that fourth doses were not yet needed and said it was too premature to be discussing a potential fourth dose of coronavirus vaccine for most people.

item.title: The Dangerous Push to Give Boosters to Teens
item.description: The emergence of the Omicron variant urged the need for boosters, however, underlying data didn’t necessarily support that it was time for booster shots to be FDA approved for teens 16 and up when it was announced.

item.title: COVID-19 Vaccine Makers Plan for Annual Boosters, but It’s Not Clear They’ll Be Needed
item.description: Debates about whether or not booster shots will be required as new data from Israel comes into the mainstream

item.title: US opens COVID boosters to all adults, urges them for 50+
item.description: When the booster shot was released to the public, the government urged people to take it, especially state governments that acted before federal officials to allow it to all adults. While some experts worry that the booster may disencourage unvaccinated people to take the first dose, others believe that the temporary boost is necessary for the holidays approaching.

item.title: The Booster-Shot Debate Was a Debacle
item.description: before the booster shot was released to the public, there were many debates on whether or not it was necessary or ethical to release it. Additionally, this source includes the unequal distribution of the Booster shot.

item.title: KFF COVID-19 Vaccine Monitor Polling
item.description: Opinions about boosters are largley divided by vaccine status and party membership.

item.title: CDC Overrules Advisory Panel
item.description: C.D.C. Chief Overrules Agency Panel and Recommends Pfizer-BioNTech Boosters for Workers at Risk

item.title: A CDC Panel Backs Booster Shots For Older Adults, A Step Toward Making Them Available
item.description: CDC suggests vulnerable groups receive third dose of COVID-19 vaccine

item.title: FDA Authorizes Booster Dose of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine for Certain Populations
item.description: FDA authorization for a booster dose of Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine for people in 65 and older, people at high risk of severe disease, and people whose jobs put them at risk of infection.

item.title: F.D.A. Advisory Panel
item.description: insufficient evidence to recommend third shots for all adult recipients of the vaccine, as Pfizer had requested

item.title: New Study of Covid Booster Shots Fans Debate Over Benefits
item.description: As a short period study on the effectiveness of a third booster is released from Israel, Government and health officials debate on whether to push for a booster and for whom, all before the F.D.A has even approved a third dose

item.title: Lancet Letter Opposing Boosters
item.description: …current vaccine supplies could save more lives if used in previously unvaccinated populations than if used as boosters in vaccinated populations.

item.title: Do We Need Booster Shots More than the World Needs Vaccines
item.description: … Director of the World Health Organization said booster programs “make a mockery of vaccine equity.”

item.title: Mayo Clinic Study
item.description: … effectiveness against infection was lower for both vaccines (mRNA-1273: 76%, 95% CI: 58-87%; BNT162b2: 42%, 95% CI: 13-62%)

item.title: CDC NY vaccine effectiveness
item.description: Vaccine effectiveness against hospitalization remains relatively stable, but drops against infection.

item.title: Joint Statement from HHS Public Health and Medical Experts on COVID-19 Booster Shots
item.description: The CDC and Deparment of Health and Human Services conclude a booster shot will be needed to maximize the effects of the vaccine.

item.title: Interim statement on COVID-19 vaccine booster doses
item.description: As debate for vaccines sparks around the world, the World Health Organization releases a statement on their review on booster effectiveness as well as recommendations

item.title: WHO calls for halting COVID-19 vaccine boosters in favor of unvaccinated
item.description: The WHO calls for a halt on COVID-19 vaccine boosters until at least the end of September as gap between wealthy and poor countries widens. Boosters had begun being debated and used to counter spread of emerging new variants.

item.title: Humoral immune response in inactivated SARS-CoV-2 vaccine: When should a booster dose be administered?
item.description: Antibody concentrations after vaccination with two doses were found to be decreased. A booster at months 6-12 is recommended for the inactive SARS-CoV-2 vaccination.

item.title: Pfizer to seek FDA authorization for third, booster dose of its Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Phizer wants to get a booster shot authorization from the FDA because Phizer’s research suggests that antibodies from initial doses are weening

item.title: Template you can copy
item.description: …very short summary of the item

item.title: Eric Topol
item.description: Tweets by Eric Topol
